thread.title: Leyton Orient confirm Danny Webb has resigned from League Two crisis club
thread.title_full: Leyton Orient confirm Danny Webb has resigned from League Two crisis club

author: tsheen
title: Leyton Orient confirm Danny Webb has resigned from League Two crisis club
text:
Leyton Orient confirm Danny Webb has resigned from League Two crisis club 
SunSport revealed on Wednesday night that Webb was to leave post By Tom Sheen 30th March 2017, 9:49 am Updated: 30th March 2017, 10:57 am Comments LEYTON ORIENT have confirmed that Danny Webb has resigned from the League Two crisis club. 
SunSport broke the news on Wednesday night that Webb intended to step down from The O’s after a bust-up with controversial owner Francesco Becchetti. Rex Features Danny Webb has resigned from Leyton Orient after a bust-up with owner Francesco Becchetti Getty Images 5 Controversial millionaire owner Francesco Becchetti was meddling in team selection and Webb had enough 
In a statement on the club website, Orient confirmed that assistant boss Omer Riza will take over first-team duties “until the end of the season”– he becomes the crisis club’s FIFTH manager of the season. 
The club said: “[Riza is] very determined to make sure that the team finishes the season strong and he’s looking forward for the challenge.” 
Webb leaves Brisbane road after Italian Bechetti again began meddling in team affairs, telling him who he wanted to be played. 
Like Kevin Nolan before him, the 33-year-old Webb refused to co-operate and has opted to walk away. 
Although Webb only won two of his 12 games games in charge, he was known to be popular in the dressing room and the move has left players upset.

Alexis Sanchez casts doubts over Arsenal future after saying he wants to stay in London and play for winning team Yes way Jose Jose Mourinho is eyeing up a potential move for Atletico Madrid centre-back Jose Gimenez 'He is absurd' Jose Mourinho compares Manchester United's attempts to buy Neymar as like trying to crack open a vault Handy Andy Gladbach confirm Andreas Christensen WILL return to Chelsea after ace impressed Antonio Conte CUT AND DRIES Manchester United to offer £30m Dries Mertens £4.3m salary in bid to poach him from Napoli Andrew Orchard sports photography 5 Orient are on the brink of non-League just three years after almost reaching the Championship in the play-off final 
Just last weekend, after Orient lost 3-0 at Crawley, Webb spoke optimistically about the future, wanting to build the club from the ground-up again. 
He said: “Instead of making excuses about what we’ve got, I’m thinking about the positives of what we’ve got and what we can add to for next season, if it’s in the National League or League Two. 
“I’m doing my best to put a plan in place and I’ve got no assurances myself, so I feel a little bit hard done by in that sense.” PA:Press Association 5 Becchetti has stopped attending matches and no longer puts money into the club 
Such has been the turnaround and promotion of coaching staff, Riza started the season as an assistant youth team coach. 
Not only are Orient staring at relegation from the Football League, they are facing a number of issues off the field . 
Last week they paid the taxman at the High Court after a winding up order, but now more creditors are owed money. 
After being a defeat away from the Championship in 2014, Becchetti’s short reign has nearly seen the club go out of existence. 
The Italian no longer attends matches, does not put any money into the club and is staring at another relegation. Fred Nathan Leyton Orient faced a winding up order at the High Court earlier this month 
But Becchetti, who lives in a £20m Mayfair mansion, is still getting involved in first-team affairs. 
Riza is now the ELEVENTH manager to take charge of the club in the 33 months since Becchetti bought the club. 
Previous owner Barry Hearn had just six managers in 19 YEARS. Video of moment Leyton Orient star Liam Kelly shoves Plymouth ballboy to the ground
